dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6846 IH: Corruption, Overthrowing Rule of Law, and Ruining Ukraine: Putin’s Trifecta Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Malinowski (for himself, Mr. Keating, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Cohen, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Phillips, Mr. Meijer, Mr. Allred, Mr. Hudson, Mr. Veasey, Mr. Hill, Ms. Spanberger, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Mr. Cicilline, Mr. Kinzinger, and Mr. Lieu) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To require a review of sanctions with respect to Russian kleptocrats and human rights abusers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Corruption, Overthrowing Rule of Law, and Ruining Ukraine: Putin’s Trifecta Act or CORRUPT Act.

section.header: Review of sanctions with respect to Russian kleptocrats and human rights abusers

subsection.header: Determination with respect to imposition of sanctions
subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a determination, including a detailed justification, of whether any person listed in subsection (b) meets the criteria for the imposition of sanctions under provisions of law that authorize the imposition of sanctions relating to corruption or human rights violations.
The persons listed in this subsection, which include Russian persons and current and former Russian government officials, are the following:

paragraph.text: Roman Abramovich, businessman.
Denis Bortnikov, Deputy President and Chairman of the Management Board of VTB Bank.
Andrey Kostin, President and Chairman of the Management Board of VTB Bank.
Dmitry Patrushev, Minister of Agriculture.
Igor Shuvalov, Chairman of the State Development Corporation VEB.
Alisher Usmanov, businessman.
Oleg Deripaska, businessman.
Alexei Miller, Chairman of the Management Committee of Gazprom.
Igor Sechin, Chairman of the Management Board of Rosneft.
Gennady Timchenko, businessman.
Nikolai Tokarev, Chairman of Transneft.
Andrey Vorobyev, Governor of the Moscow Region XIII.
Mikhail Murashko, Minister of Health.
Vladimir Solovyev, media personality.
Alexander Bastrykin, Head of the Investigative Committee.
Alexander Bortnikov, Director of the Federal Security Service (FSB).
Konstantin Ernst, Chief Executive Officer of Channel One TV station.
Victor Gavrilov, Head of the Department of Transport of the Economic Security Service.
Dmitry Ivanov, Head of Chelyabinsk FSB.
Alexander Kalashnikov, Director of the Federal Penitentiary Service (FSIN).
Sergei Kirienko, First Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration.
Elena Morozova, Judge of Khimki District Court.
Denis Popov, Chief Prosecutor of Moscow.
Margarita Simonyan, Editor-in-Chief of RT.
Igor Yanchuk, Head of the Khimki Police Department.
Victor Zolotov, Director of the National Guard.
Alexander Beglov, Governor of St. Petersburg.
Yuri Chaika, former Prosecutor General.
Andrei Kartapolov, Deputy Defense Minister.
Pavel Krasheninnikov, Parliamentarian and former Justice Minister.
Mikhail Mishustin, Prime Minister of Russia.
Ella Pamfilova, Head of Central Electoral Commission.
Dmitry Peskov, Presidential Press Secretary.
Sergei Sobyanin, Mayor of Moscow.
Anton Vaino, Head of the Presidential Administration.

subsection.text: In this section, the term appropriate congressional committees means—

paragraph.text: the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Foreign Relations and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate.
